replies.body:
They did a huge write up about that a while ago, discussing what "skill" meant. Did it mean timekeeping and detailed records? Or did it mean being able to plan out and execute an attack or defense better than your opponent?

Out thinking and out playing rather than out writing?

Riot has seemingly decided (reds aren't always accurate or even knowledgeable) that being able to out play your opponent is more important than being able to out timekeep your opponent. Which is fair enough, likely why the new emphasis on minigames inside the game instead of "Hit X to do damage".

The don't get to decide what skill is. We do. 
Devs' trying to tell their players what skill is, is how the first Natural Selection, Firefall, Tribes; Ascend and various other games FLOPPED.

I reckon for dragon/baron you shouldn 't be able to hear the death sound globally. With baron if the enemy team has it, sure you can see the buff on the enemy team, etc. With dragon you don't see any buffs earlier on in stacks. I reckon you should only be able to have the timer updated if you have warded dragon/baron or have vision of either on time of death. In games I've played some people are utterly lazy when it comes to warding etc, and this will just give them the excuse I think that "oh we have updated timers regardless, etc so it doesn't matter".

Wards shouldn't really be for static objectives though, that's what timekeeping was for, and these days it's what TAB is for. Wards are for monitoring the movement of your opponents. It's why the brush just to the mid side of dragon pit is usually a better warding spot than inside dragon pit. It's why tri brush is a great spot. It maximises your ward coverage (Multiple paths converging on the same spot makes it more likely someone will pass) as opposed to a ward inside baron pit which is more a desperation ward than anything else.

If you've set up your wards properly then you'll have a good idea of where everyone is anyway, or after you've played a while and get used to the play patterns then you'll be able to estimate where people are, and at that point you'll know if they're heading towards baron or dragon.
Uhhhhhh why would you make the Dragon and Baron timers shown to both teams automatically? AFAIK this wasn't even on PBE patch notes and hasn't had feedback. Seems like a stupid change.

It makes sense because both teams hear their death sound globally if it dies now regardless
so you know it's death time even if you're not there, the game is just being more kind to deaf people now

I just think people are going to be more lazy when it comes to warding baron and dragon and stuff because oh they hear the death sound globally and now the timer updates so there is no need to ward. Also makes for sneaking dragon harder since it will be more obvious now. At least with baron once you get it the other team knows due to visual buff indicators

People don't ward baron know so that they know when he dies.

They ward it so they can prevent him from dying.

That's stupid. Wards aren't available to track neutral monsters, they're for tracking your opponents. If a team doesn't ward and then tries to take baron, they're gonna get buttfucked, automatic timer or not. This change is to stop the snowball effect of taking barons and dragon on respawn, because that strategy is cancer.

I didn't say wards were solely for tracking neutral monsters but wards **are** to provide vision for your team on the map. I've just seen quite a few games where some people apart from myself don't even provide warded vision of enemy team around dragon and baron. I just think this may cause for some people to get lazy in terms of warding and not ward prior to the respawn timers which they should do regardless but eh.
Having accurate knowledge of respawn timers should encourage players to think about approaching the objective ahead of time.
wouldn't matter, if they are bad not to notice a team doing drag, they probably won't win anyway
It was in the PBE. I believe they had it so that the timer updates once you see a champion with the buff though. Don't remember them adding the global death sound.
there are already 3rd party program mes that give players that info riot is making it so its on there software so 3rd party program's aren't used

Can't see any opponents on the map? Baron hasn't spawned? They're doing dragon. See when they get back to lane, subtract appropriate time off that (If they show up at inhib turret top lane and drag is bot, then it was around 20s unless they recalled, which you can tell from the direction they came) and you have an approximate time dragon went down.

Subtract ~10s from that, and note in chat "Drag XX:XX".

You can usually follow the clues and get an approximate time of death. When someone can't though, if you sneak a dragon, it means you now know the time of death and you can use that knowledge to get every single dragon after that. It's a way of hard snowballing a game which made such objectives situationally way too powerful, and other times between even teams with good team comps they were a lot less powerful, and Riot doesn't like variability in their game. Harder to plan around and balance chaos. :P

It's a good change as it's easier to keep track of (assuming no 3rd party tool) when you don't it go down but do have an approximate time, and the power of the soft objective is now the power of the soft objective and that's it; it can't be set up to snowball by itself as the other team will be able to contest it when it respawns.
Can we get something done about the people in ranked champion select who pick a lane no matter if someone else has called it and go there after the first person has already locked in

nope, rules of the game. 
https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752884-Reporting-a-Player#h2q2
But reporting someone does hardly anything but makes them basically say "I won't do it again". Then they go do it again!

How do you play against people your level/rank? I finally got bronze 2 the other day and I win my first game and then the next 3 games I versed 1-3 players in silver 4 and above each game and got rekt! Can't I vs other bronze players. It makes it impossible to climb when you have bronze people on your team feeding a silver that is already better than you! So I got demoted again :(.
Umm what happened to semi-locked camera? Can't find it anywhere..

this new patch 5.14 is stupid ive been hanging for 2 days to play this game now and as far as i can get it clicking on the desktop item and then for it to say program unresponsive. i try to ctrl alt delete and close program down but wont let me as it says i have no access. i enjoyed this game but as of this patch it has pissed me off to the point where im not sure i want to continue playing if errors occur everytime i play.

The only problem with Tahm Kench IMO is his regurgitate damage, for a champ its 32% (+2% for every 100 AP) of target's max health can be a little problematic, and than 300(+60% AP) for regurgitating a minion. 32% of a tank's hp can easily win a fight, especially paired with 3 second devour duration.
Ctrl + F isnt working... i like to keep an eye on my latency
i literally do not want to play anymore with this new disgusting hud
New QUINN SKIN! AND IT LOOKS GREAT!! XD

So, Zeke's Harbinger gives you +20% AP for 6 seconds? If you're playing a support that can deal a lot of burst damage (_cough_ {{champion:1}} _cough_), this could be really broken when combined with the +30% from {{item:3089}}.

Once people notice this, I think a see a nerf comming...

It's more of a mid to late game item though, by which point the AP is already hurting you anyway, and any good AP nuker support has gotten a decent item under their belt (I like Morello's, it's a good mix of CDR, AP, and the healing reduction is useful to slow down the trend of seeing AD's with Summoner Heal). I'd only really get this item in a kill lane (GP support Xin AD kind of thing) or once teamfights started happening fairly frequently.

Otherwise it's not nearly as useful as an item which gives you more guaranteed damage or utility.
{{item:3089}} it's now 35 %, tons of damage!

Never mind a 50% crit chance to the adc... who by the time you get this probably already has phantom dancer and / or at least IE... even without that, a vayne with just a botrk and 50%  crit? condemn, dead

Not just Vayne, any champion that uses crit effectively or as part of their kit; {{champion:22}} {{champion:86}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:23}} {{champion:157}} and especially the new {{champion:41}} 

But that all depends on what your teammates play as (I doubt any Yi would build this, for example) It's more likely that you'll see some Mages build this to get some extra bang in a teamfight; ({{champion:7}} with +50% AP, **Yikes!**).

Hey Riot
WHY BUFF EKKO!!????
HE'S OP ALREADY, (btw tyvm 4 nerfing 0.2 ratio to 0.1 ratio ap on ulti + ulti now has mana)
Can you turn Akali but to what she was because the previous patches messed up the game style of Akali considering you no longer can do a proper 'Q' and 'E' combo.

can we have the total damage in the death recap sorted by type? as in, the text up the top which currently says "3000 damage over 12 seconds" becomes "3000 damage over 12 seconds (1500 magic, 1000 physical, 500 true)"
WHEN?! {{champion:32}} {{item:3070}}
I like what riot have done with this
And it's not as if a team that's getting remarkably outplayed has ever relied on their dragon control at least to keep them in the game. Just as a further point.

I definitely like the 'conduit' idea for support items and a whole line of them would be great. I like how you can change who you're 'paired' with throughout the game depending on circumstances and that this item in particular can be used to buff a whole variety of champions. Though the charging system seems kind of complicated (I'll see in game) and the buff stats also seem kind of odd. But overall a great concept.

I'm hoping that with baron/dragon timers and team summoner/ult timers now being displayed in game and in the new hud that soon the same will be true for enemy summoner/ult timers. I don't think it'll be 'dumbing down' the game because it's the same thing as a teammate communicating this information to their team through voice comms or through (the clumsiness) of typing it in chat. I feel this would make skirmishes more skill based with all knowledge available as I know how annoying it can be to mess up a gank/kill and potentially wasting your own resources because a teammate hasn't communicated whether an enemy flash is up or not, just as an example.

The new item doesn't really speak to me. I mean, besides the crit chance early game the active only really benefits the support. The exceptions would be ADC's like Corki and Ezreal who can use the AP, but most other ADC's wouldn't really be able to make use of it. Also, because of the Conduit, it really is unreliable for anyone else to grab. Idk, could just be me being a stupid unranked player.

The global timers on Baron and Dragon makes sense, since it is so easy to track anyway. I don't think it will affect wards being placed there, because while you know it's down, you don't know anything about the champions who took it down. So as long as people aren't stupidly lazy, then wards should continue to be placed. 

"Proc you like a Hurricane", the guy who came up with this deserves a reward because that right there is hilarious.
when i long in on the bottom it says i have 5.14 but i dont have all they  stuff
Patch 5.14 isn't even out to be patched yet, the notes for it only just got released. It will be a few more days before the client updates to the patch
i.e. tomorrow

They're making the game too easy when it comes to recognising the timers for neutral monsters. The old players of the game used to have to time the objectives by themselves manually or via chat (communication with team). Now it's become too easy to just press tab and find out all the information with the touch of a button. Obviously this is convenient and streamlined so it was easier to overlook the change. But this global alert for dragon and baron timers is just a bit overkill in my opinion; not a fan.

Don't like snowballing dragon and baron leads? Heck, why not take snowballing out altogether and change levelling to a time based event, so no one team can snowball that... Oh, and while you're at it get rid of this pesky cs gold and make that time based as well. Way to ruin a well strategized game riot. Bravo.

really bad "quality changes", rito must be joking , more ekko buffs,ryze late game nerfs :S,  tahm kench buffs :S because no body understand him yet... , drag timers for everyone with no vision :S whats the use for warding drag then? since if the team is behind , they are behind for a reason (they are not doing well basically), its like someone working hard all year to get that uni degree and then some rich kid gets one for free... how is this fair?
Ur probably bronze cuz it's not hard to beat up ekko in lane. And the dragon timer even if ur on the energy team u will hear the death or it so  it doesn't really matter
